text: {"grade": 0, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the response to suggest a \"Sale Process Covenant Drag after 5-7 years as a GmbHG \u00a730-compliant alternative.\" The candidate answer suggests a \"Registration / \u201cPut\u201d Rights\" clause (B2) which allows the investor to request the company repurchase shares after five years at fair market value. While this is an exit mechanism after a period, it is a mandatory repurchase right (a 'Put'), not a 'Sale Process Covenant Drag' (which typically forces the majority/founders to initiate a sale process after a set time if an exit hasn't occurred, often linked to GmbHG \u00a730 requirements for minority exit rights in certain contexts).
